0.Pros: It was cool taking orders and making kids happy too get a happy meal
0.Cons: The lead was horrible they where very messy

1.Pros: Everyone is friendly and the POS is easy to operate.
1.Cons: I've worked at McDonald's twice, and both times I've been shorted on hours. I'm currently working at a McDonald's where the most hours I've gotten was the nine hours training period in the first week. When I was hired here, it was specifically because of my prior experience at McDonald's. The management seemed almost angry that I already was good at my job, though.

2.Pros: Make friends easy and have great oneness.
2.Cons: Sometimes things don't go with the flow..

3.Pros: Free food, great people to work with
3.Cons: Rude customers(but you learn how to deal with them)

4.Pros: You get a food discount.Meet nice people.Pays for your school tuition.
4.Cons: Hours are cut.There's always at least one person in a bad mood.

5.Pros: Easy to learn new positions, very flexible with hours, good starter job, easy to pick up extra hours, flexible with taking days off if you give them enough notice
5.Cons: Low pay, didn't like wearing the uniform everyday, didn't like smelling like food and being greasy after I got off, a lot of the workers there don't care about their job much

6.Pros: Easy, a solid starting job, not much pressure or responsibility, can get promoted if you want to.
6.Cons: The Pay is barely above minimum wage, can get tiring, working with a lot of teenagers and undependable people

7.Pros: Easy interview, lots of questions, benefits were available after a period of time
7.Cons: Low pay and wish it was more

9.Cons: Wishing it was the first place I could have worked
